responses.content: Delivered outstanding start to the year despite evolving dynamics related to tariffs/regulatory environment. Revenue/EPS exceeded consensus. Data Center and Client/Gaming both grew large double digit percentage. Expanded gross margin year-over-year for 5th straight quarter.

Revenue $3.7B (+57% YoY). Gained server CPU share with 5th Gen EPYC Turin. Hyperscaler demand strong. Enterprise adoption accelerating (EPYC-powered cloud instances by Forbes 2000 doubled YoY). MI300 series platforms in production. MI350 sampling, production mid-year.

Client revenue grew 68% YoY. Fifth consecutive quarter of revenue share gains. Record client CPU ASP driven by rich mix (Ryzen 9000, X3D). Desktop channel sellout >50% YoY. Gaming revenue down 30% YoY due to semi-custom, but Radeon 9070 series saw strong demand.

Acquisition of ZT Systems closed. MI350 series on track for 2H ramp (35x higher throughput vs MI300X). MI400 on track for 2026 launch. Focused on rack-scale solutions. Working on AI diffusion rules and sovereign AI deployments.

Q2 Revenue ~$7.4B (+/- $300M). Includes $700M revenue reduction from new export license requirement for MI308 to China. Full year impact ~$1.5B. Confident in strong double digit percentage revenue growth for 2025.
Revenue $7.4B (+36% YoY). Gross margin 54% (Non-GAAP), up 140 bps YoY. Operating income $1.8B (24% margin). EPS $0.96 (+55% YoY). Operating cash flow $939M, Free cash flow $727M.
Data Center: $3.7B (+57% YoY), Op Margin 25%. Client/Gaming: $2.9B (+28% YoY), Op Margin 17%. Embedded: $823M (-3% YoY), Op Margin 40%.
Q2 Non-GAAP GM ~43% due to ~$800M charge for inventory/reserves related to China export controls. Excluding charge, GM would be ~54%. OpEx ~$2.3B (includes $50M for ZT Systems design team).

questions: Drivers of client strength (up 67% YoY)? Any tariff-related pull-ins?
How did Ex-China Instinct perform in Q1? Thoughts on 2H ramp?
answers: Lisa Su: Client strength driven by desktop performance and ASPs, not tariff pull-ins. Q2 guide includes $700M MI308 headwind.
Lisa Su: Instinct Q1 performance in line/better. MI350 launch mid-year, strong growth expected in 2H.

questions: DC GPU growth vs expectations? Does the $800M charge/ban impact Q4?
Inventory up significantly - is this ZT related?
answers: Lisa Su: DC GPU performed well. Majority of $1.5B China impact is in Q2/Q3. Q4 planned as non-China (MI350).
Jean Hu: Inventory build is for Client/Server ramp and 2H DC GPU ramp (long lead times).

questions: What is AMD doing to address ease of deployment for MI400 rack scale?
Drivers for 7 consecutive quarters of EPYC enterprise share gains?
answers: Lisa Su: ZT Systems acquisition specifically addresses rack scale. Active planning with customers.
Lisa Su: Product strength (Turin) and significant investment in go-to-market/direct enterprise engagement.

questions: Is DC GPU revenue flat 1H vs 2H excluding China impact?
Will Gross Margin return to 54%+ in 2H?
answers: Jean Hu: Yes, 1H flat vs 2H roughly. 2H weighted due to MI355 ramp.
Jean Hu: Q2 ex-charge is 54%. 2H expected to improve slightly due to DC growth.

questions: Does AMD have necessary interconnect/system pieces? Build vs Partner?
View on full year Client share gains vs market?
answers: Lisa Su: Have all pieces + deep partnerships. Focused on interoperability.
Lisa Su: Gaining revenue share in premium segments (high-end, commercial). Inventory healthy.

questions: Did GPU sales grow sequentially in Q1? Can they grow in 2025 despite China headwind?
Impact of China restrictions/AI diffusion rules on $500B TAM?
answers: Lisa Su: Yes, strong double digit growth for full year. Q1 down modestly seq. China restrictions already factored into TAM.

questions: Thoughts on 2H Client seasonality?
MI400/Rack scale go-to-market strategy?
answers: Lisa Su: Planning for sub-seasonal 2H because 1H was so strong (upgrade cycle).
Lisa Su: Early start on MI400 rack scale with hyperscalers and OEMs.

questions: Can DC GPU grow YoY in Q2/Q3 given headwinds?
Clarification on Q1 DC GPU and Server CPU sequential trends?
answers: Lisa Su: Q2 will not grow YoY (due to $700M hit). Q3/Q4 will grow YoY.
Jean Hu: DC GPU declined seq (modestly). Server CPU declined seq.

questions: Confidence in Embedded 2H ramp?
OpEx outlook with ZT?
answers: Jean Hu: Gradual recovery seen in order patterns. Q4 expected to grow YoY.
Jean Hu: $50M incremental OpEx from ZT design. Revenue growing faster than OpEx.

questions: Impact of reasoning models/inference costs?
Competing with custom silicon (ASICs) at customers?
answers: Lisa Su: Reasoning models increase inference need (plays to memory bandwidth strengths).
Lisa Su: Not either/or. GPUs have larger share due to model evolution. Competitive TCO key.
